intro: Euphorbia ambatofinandranae, commonly known as the Ambatofinandrahina euphorbia, is a rare and endemic species native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its unique, spiny stems and clustered, yellowish-green cyathia. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, adapting to the arid and semi-arid conditions of its native habitat. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for taxonomic study and conservation efforts due to its limited distribution and vulnerability to environmental changes.
